mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to George Augustine Washington, 1787 September 2
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: While presiding over the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia, George Washington wrote this detailed letter of instruction for the care of Mount Vernon to his nephew and farm manager George Augustine Washington. Dated September 2, 1787, Washington provides directions for farming, furnishing the mansion, caring for his servants, and managing expenses. Regarding the decoration of the small dining room Washington says, "I am sorry to find that the Green paint which was got to give the Dining room another Coat should have turned out so bad; such impositions (besides the disappointment) are really shameful." Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
